summary:
Pharaohs were the rulers of ancient Egypt, starting around 3150 BCE. They were also known as "kings," and their titles included Horus, Sedge and Bee, and Nebty names. Pharaohs acted as leaders and religious figures, connecting the people to the gods. They owned all the land, made laws, and led the army.

Early pharaohs wore different crowns symbolizing Upper and Lower Egypt. The Red Crown (Deshret) and White Crown (Hedjet) were combined into the Pschent after the kingdoms united. Later, new headdresses like the Nemes and Khepresh were introduced.
title: Pharaoh
